Former Chairman of Hanchongryon Arrested
articles.content:
Former Chairman of Hanchongryon Arrested 
    Pyongyang, February 3 (KCNA) -- The south Korean security authorities walked off Chairman of the 9th-term south Korean Federation of University
Student Councils (Hanchongryon) Choe Sung Hwan on the charge of violation of the draconic "National Security Law" on Jan. 29, according to a press report.
 He is reportedly under investigation in detention though he had been under treatment in Seoul for his illness that turned worse due to his life exposed to protracted police search.

Cultural Event Held in S. Korea
articles.content:
Cultural Event Held in S. Korea 
    Pyongyang, February 3 (KCNA) -- A cultural event for inheriting the spirit of Kim Ryang Mu, a pro-reunification patriotic martyr, on the fifth anniversary of his death was reportedly held at Kyunghee University in Seoul on Jan. 29 with the attendance of his family members and members of civic and public organizations, at least 500 in all, under the sponsorship of the committee for the promotion of the event.
 At the cultural event Yun Han Thak, chairman of the Association for Inheriting the Spirit of Pro-Reunification Patriotic Martyr Kim Ryang Mu, called for fighting in the spirit of certainly accomplishing the cause of reunification this year, true to the intention of the patriotic martyr who desired   national reunification till the last moments of his life. 
 An art performance was given by the central literary and art group of Hanchongryon (south Korean Federation of University Student Councils) and others at the event.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Greets Sri Lankan President
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Greets Sri Lankan President 
    Pyongyang, February 3 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Thursday sent a message of greetings to Sri Lankan President Chandrika Bandaranaike Kumaratunga on the day of its independence.
 Expressing belief that the cooperative relations between the two friendly countries would grow stronger in the interests of the two peoples, the message wished the government and the people of Sri Lanka stability, prosperity and welfare.

articles.title: Message of Sympathy to Guyanese President
articles.content:
Message of Sympathy to Guyanese President
    Pyongyang, February 3 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People�fs Assembly, on Jan. 31 sent a message of sympathy to Bharrat Jagdeo, president of Guyana , as regards the heavy rain and flood
that hit his country, claiming great casualties and material damage.
 The message sincerely hoped that the Guyanese government would eradicate the aftermath of natural disasters as early as possible and bring the living of the people in the afflicted area to normal.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Greets Vietnamese President
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Greets Vietnamese President
    Pyongyang, February 3 (KCNA) -- President Kim Yong Nam of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly on Jan. 31 sent a message of greetings to Tran Duc Luong, Vietnamese president, on the occasion of the 55th anniversary of the opening of diplomatic ties between the DPRK and Vietnam.
 Congratulating the Vietnamese president, the message wished him success in
his work.

articles.title: Messages of Greetings Exchanged
articles.content:
Messages of Greetings Exchanged
    Pyongyang, February 3 (KCNA) -- DPRK Foreign Minister Paek Nam Sun and Vietnamese Foreign Minster Nguyen Dy Nien exchanged messages of greetings on the 55th anniversary of the opening of diplomatic ties between the two countries.
 The foreign ministers wished each other success in their work.

articles.title: Felicitations to Sri Lankan Prime Minister
articles.content:
Felicitations to Sri Lankan Prime Minister
    Pyongyang, February 3 (KCNA) -- Premier of the DPRK Cabinet Pak Pong Ju sent a congratulatory message to Sri Lankan Prime Minister Mahinda Rajapakse on the day of its independence.
 Expressing the conviction that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would steadily grow in scope and develop in various domains, it sincerely wished the prime minister greater success in his work for the stability and prosperity of the country.    
 Meanwhile, DPRK Foreign Minister Paek Nam Sun sent a congratulatory message to Sri Lankan Foreign Minister Lakshman Kadirgamar.
